sections.text: Dukeâ€™s MSN prepares advanced practice nurses and nurse leaders through specialty tracks that integrate evidence-based clinical training with leadership and interprofessional collaboration.

items: Core in advanced pathophysiology, pharmacology, and health assessment
Specialty tracks (e.g., NP specialties, Nursing & Healthcare Leadership)
sections.text: Students complete advanced nursing core and specialty coursework with supervised clinical hours and a culminating project.

items: BSN or equivalent and active RN license (for most specialty tracks)
Completion of required credits and clinical hours
sections.text: Applicants must meet nursing licensure and academic prerequisites; graduation requires completion of credits and clinical experiences.
Graduates become advanced practice clinicians and leaders in health systems, community health, and specialized care settings.
